name: 3'-chloro-4'-fluoroacetanilide
Reason: 3'-chloro-4'-fluoroacetanilide has a basic unit of acetanilide, which has a melting point of 113-114°C. The presence of the chlorine atom introduces a halogen atom, which can increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and the ability to participate in dipole-dipole interactions. The estimated increase due to the chlorine atom is +10°C. The fluorine atom also introduces a halogen atom, but due to its smaller size, it has a weaker effect than chlorine. The estimated increase due to the fluorine atom is +5°C. The net increase due to the halogen atoms is +15°C.
